item.title: Loads of help plz?
item.dc:creator: @iceman327 iceman327
item.description:
@iceman327 wrote:

You add this in your client.java dude[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 02, 2008, 02:54:58 AM[/size][hr][quote=“xx nub xx, post:7, topic:170081”][quote author=iceman327 link=topic=229920.msg1970589#msg1970589 date=1199281423]
If you have two of the same command
its going to do the first one first

btw it should look like this

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pkduel1") { addItem(4315, 1); teleportToX = 3097; teleportToY = 3939; sendMessage("You have sucked a dick!!"); } [br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 02, 2008, 02:45:35 AM[/size][hr]it should be this

[code]
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“blackstuff”) {

addItem(1165, 1); 
addItem(1125, 1);
addItem(1077, 1);
addItem(1089, 1);
addItem(1107, 1);
addItem(1151, 1);
addItem(1179, 1);
addItem(1195, 1);
addItem(1217, 1);
addItem(1283, 1);
addItem(1297, 1);
addItem(1313, 1);
addItem(1327, 1);
addItem(1341, 1);
addItem(1361, 1);
addItem(1367, 1);
addItem(1426, 1);
addItem(3098, 1);
addItem(3196, 1);
addItem(4125, 1);
addItem(4580, 1);

sendMessage(“You spawn some black stuff”);
} [/code]

[/quote]

it really doesnt matter what order its in… not in this case anyway.

and obviously you aren’t compiling it… or you aren’t saving, because the server can’t do anything you didn’t program, and if that is the case, you did not do one of the two things i said.[/quote]

I know that but he had two ((
and thats the order i like to do it in

Read full topic

item.title: Loads of help plz?

item.description:
@xx_nub_xx wrote:

[quote=“iceman327, post:4, topic:170081”]If you have two of the same command
its going to do the first one first

btw it should look like this

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pkduel1") { addItem(4315, 1); teleportToX = 3097; teleportToY = 3939; sendMessage("You have sucked a dick!!"); } [br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 02, 2008, 02:45:35 AM[/size][hr]it should be this

[code]
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“blackstuff”) {

addItem(1165, 1); 
addItem(1125, 1);
addItem(1077, 1);
addItem(1089, 1);
addItem(1107, 1);
addItem(1151, 1);
addItem(1179, 1);
addItem(1195, 1);
addItem(1217, 1);

addItem(1297, 1);

it really doesnt matter what order its in… not in this case anyway.

and obviously you aren’t compiling it… or you aren’t saving, because the server can’t do anything you didn’t program, and if that is the case, you did not do one of the two things i said.

item.title: Loads of help plz?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

I think this looks better;

else if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("blackstuff")) { int[] ids = { 1165, 1125, 1077, 1089, 1107, 1151, 1195, 1179, 1217, 1283, 1297, 1313, 1327, 1341, 1361, 1367, 1426, 3098, 3196, 4125, 4580 }; for(int i : ids) { addItem(i, 1); } }

item.title: Loads of help plz?
item.dc:creator: @hellobud hellobud
item.description:
@hellobud wrote:

EDIT:
can somebody please tell me how to change:
server name
command list - sendMessage (“insert text here”);

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pkduel1")) { sendMessage("You have entered pkduel!!"); addItem(4315, 1); teleportToX = 3097; teleportToY = 3939; }

but i want to change it to

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pkduel1")) { sendMessage("You have sucked a dick!!"); addItem(4315, 1); teleportToX = 3097; teleportToY = 3939; }

when i change it, it still says “you have entered pkduel!!”

some1 plz help

oh and can some1 tell me why this command doesnt work???

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("blackstuff")) { sendMessage("You spawn some black stuff"); addItem(1165, 1); addItem(1125, 1); addItem(1077, 1); addItem(1089, 1); addItem(1107, 1); addItem(1151, 1); addItem(1179, 1); addItem(1195, 1); addItem(1217, 1); addItem(1283, 1); addItem(1297, 1); addItem(1313, 1); addItem(1327, 1); addItem(1341, 1); addItem(1361, 1); addItem(1367, 1); addItem(1426, 1); addItem(3098, 1); addItem(3196, 1); addItem(4125, 1); addItem(4580, 1); }
